dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#GeneralDescription
dataObjects.title: Biology
dataObjects.description: Occurs in swamps, swampy parts of brooks and pools in the humid coastal rainforest (Ref. 3788).  9 cm TL (7372).  Bottom spawner, 3 months incubation.  Is difficult to maintain in aquarium (Ref. 27139).

dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Lalèyè, P. 2010. Callopanchax monroviae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description: This species is endemic to Liberia. The range of distribution extends from the drainage system of the Lower Mano River to that of the Lower Saint Paul River in southern and southwestern Liberia.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Distribution
dataObjects.description: Africa:  between the lower Mano river drainage and the lower St. Paul river drainage in southern Liberia.

dataObjects.subject: http://rs.tdwg.org/ontology/voc/SPMInfoItems#Conservation
dataObjects.title: IUCN Red List Assessment
dataObjects.rights: © International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.rightsHolder: International Union for Conservation of Nature and Natural Resources
dataObjects.bibliographicCitation: Lalèyè, P. 2010. Callopanchax monroviae. In: IUCN 2014 . IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. Version 2014.1 . <www.iucnredlist.org>
dataObjects.description:
Red List Category
VU
Vulnerable

Red List Criteria
B1ab(iii)+2ab(iii); D2

Version
3.1

Year Assessed
2010

Assessor/s
Lalèyè, P.

Reviewer/s
Entsua-Mensah, M., Darwall, W. & Smith, K.

Contributor/s

Justification
The estimated extent of occurrence and area of occupancy are less than 10,000 km² and 2,000 km², respectively. It is only known from five locations from Liberia. The extent and quality of habitat is undergoing and continuous decline due to urbanisation, mining, agriculture and deforestation developments.The species is therefore assessed as Vulnerable B1ab(iii)+2ab(iii). As it is only known from only five locations which are under threats from habitat degradation it also qualifies as Vulnerable D2.
